title: EEG Experiments Seeking Participants
text:
Would you like to know more about how we investigate how the brain works?

Our laboratory is currently conducting EEG experiments and is looking for healthy volunteers to participate.

What's involved:
  • EEG recording: During the experiment, we will record your brain activity using electroencephalography (EEG).This is a non-invasive procedure that involves placing electrodes on your scalp.
  • Tasks: The experiments typically involve performing simple tasks, such as face recognition and memory tests.
  • Time commitment: Our experiments usually last 1-2 hours.
  • Compensation: Participants will receive SONA credits for their time (typically 1-2 SONA credits, 1 credit/hour, 15 minute increments).
  • Place: Bournemouth University, Talbot Campus.

To participate:
